description: From Middle English *bedasen (found in past participle bedased, bedasyd (“dazed, dizzy”)), equivalent to be- +‎ daze.

verbs.description: bedaze (third-person singular simple present bedazes, present participle bedazing, simple past and past participle bedazed)

examples: On his first trip to the circus, he was bedazed by the myriad colours, sounds and smells.
